Write a review Sort by Most recent Most recent Most helpful Highest rating Lowest rating KCCamper 1 reviews · 1 review votes Member 1 1 out of 5 stars 02/23/2023 Bait and Switch...Never Again.  Made my reservations five months earlier for Feb 2023.  Jan 2023, the campground called and said I needed to pay for my Feb 2023 stay or lose my deposit and the price went up so I had to pay more money though the email they sent five months ago contained the lower price they originally quoted me.  (They charged more than KOA's campgrounds!)  Payment wasn't supposed to be due until 30 days before arrival, they wanted their money before the 30 days.  The site was very... Read More Bait and Switch...Never Again.  Made my reservations five months earlier for Feb 2023.  Jan 2023, the campground called and said I needed to pay for my Feb 2023 stay or lose my deposit and the price went up so I had to pay more money though the email they sent five months ago contained the lower price they originally quoted me.  (They charged more than KOA's campgrounds!)  Payment wasn't supposed to be due until 30 days before arrival, they wanted their money before the 30 days.  The site was very tight, our awning could not be extended all the way.  The majority of the sites are like this.  Their electrical box made a sizzling sound when we plugged into the 30 amp so we plugged into the 50 amp and used a dogbone.  Backing into the site required maneuvering around old trees.  When leaving the campground, they have a sign to swing wide to avoid hitting a tree limb that overhangs the exit.  (Why not trim the tree?)   One Pro:  Campers were very friendly.   Some things we overlook but Bait and Switch is wrong and we've never had this kind of problem with any other campgrounds we have stayed in. Read Less Helpful 9 Own this park? Reply to this review CWC 1 reviews · 1 review votes Member 1 1 out of 5 stars 05/25/2020 The campground and restrooms were fine not great, but okay. However I am giving the facility only one star because of their shady way of handling the Good Sam discount program. They advertise themselves as a Good Sam park, but then only allow you to use your discount for one night. This is the only park that I've ever had restrict the number of nights that I'm allowed to use this discount. Helpful 13 Own this park? Reply to this review Cece 1 reviews · 1 review votes Member 1 1 out of 5 stars 05/23/2020 Just called to make a reservation for a tent site. I was told our pup could not come unless we have an RV. That makes no sense. They are going to be the same whether they are in a tent or RV. Pet owners beware!!! Not really pet friendly like they say on their website. It says they are not allowed in the cabins only. Misleading website that needs to be updated. Helpful 10 Own this park? Reply to this review Maine on the Go 1 reviews · 1 review votes Member 3 3 out of 5 stars 01/01/2018 Campground is old and is desperate need of upgrades. The rest rooms are very clean but severely out dated. The roads are narrow for big rigs and people parking close to them makes it hard to maneuver and back into small spaces. The pool was closed for repair so we could not use. The sewer receptacles are too far above the ground so tanks do not empty. You have to fill hose and the raise it to empty gray and black water tanks. The leaves do not get raked, we had to rake our own site since there are... Read More Campground is old and is desperate need of upgrades. The rest rooms are very clean but severely out dated. The roads are narrow for big rigs and people parking close to them makes it hard to maneuver and back into small spaces. The pool was closed for repair so we could not use. The sewer receptacles are too far above the ground so tanks do not empty. You have to fill hose and the raise it to empty gray and black water tanks. The leaves do not get raked, we had to rake our own site since there are no fire rings and were told to build fire anywhere. There are many long term residents and police were there several times dealing with some of the residents. It is very convenient to many Daytona Beach locations but it wasn't what I have come to expect from Good Sam parks. Read Less Helpful 12 Own this park? Reply to this review Sherry Thompson 5 reviews · 4 review votes Member 4 4 out of 5 stars 05/04/2017 Holy cow we picked a bad weekend to try and find an open RV site in Daytona.  There were several events happening in the city and most RV parks were all booked.  Tired and afraid we might not find a place to stay for the night, Nova was the third park we called and they had a few sites left.  We were really grateful for the site, and tho they told us it was a back in, we had no idea how hard it was going to be to get into it.  Because the park was so full, people were parked in places where they... Read More Holy cow we picked a bad weekend to try and find an open RV site in Daytona.  There were several events happening in the city and most RV parks were all booked.  Tired and afraid we might not find a place to stay for the night, Nova was the third park we called and they had a few sites left.  We were really grateful for the site, and tho they told us it was a back in, we had no idea how hard it was going to be to get into it.  Because the park was so full, people were parked in places where they shouldn't have been or hanging out into the streets.  If it had not been so late, or we had not been so tired, we would not have stayed.  With this being said, the park did feel comfortable and safe.  And though they had several amenities, we did not use them, so will not comment on them.  Would we stay here again?  Only if we were given a site that was truly accommodating for a long 5th wheel. Appears that many of the sites especially the more attractive (with best shade) ones were occupied by long term / permanent occupants.
Cable TV worked really well. Not too far away from services & Interstate.
Restrooms need serious upgrading. Might go back. Helpful 9 Own this park? Reply to this review See all reviews Book now View Website Location 1190 Herbert St, Port Orange, FL 32129 Coordinates: 29.134510, -81.014340 Directions From Jct of I-95 (Exit 256-Port Orange) & Taylor/Dunlawton Ave, E 0.7 mi on Dunlawton Ave to Clyde Morris Blvd, N (Left) 0.9 mi to Herbert St, E 0.7 mi on Herbert St (R) Get directions From $39 / night Book now View Website Previous Next How to read Good Sam Ratings The three-number rating that accompanies each campground listing in the directory gives readers an at-a-glance assessment of a campground's amenities, cleanliness and environment. All three ratings categories are measured on a scale of 1 to 10, with 10 being the best. Less than 1 percent of parks or campgrounds receive the coveted 10 | 10 | 10 rating, which indicates superior facilities that are well maintained, clean, well-appointed restrooms and a highly appealing appearance. Campgrounds are inspected annually by dedicated RVers like you. Completeness of facilities 10 10 10 The first campground rating evaluates completeness and quality of facilities. In this category we rate interior roads, sites, registration area, hookups, recreation, swimming, security, laundry, store and building maintenance. Cleanliness of restrooms and showers 10 10 10 The second rating category concerns the cleanliness and physical characteristics of toilets, walls, showers, sinks/counters/mirrors and floor. If a park achieves a full point in each of the above, it receives a star ( ), indicating exceptionally clean restrooms. Also rated are physical characteristics of restrooms, including interior construction, adequate supplies/odor free, adequate number of facilities, exterior appearance and location in relation to park spaces, and interior appearance. Visual appeal and environmental quality 10 10 10 This category addresses the park's setting and site layout, function and identification of signage, overall exterior building maintenance, noise, trash disposal, litter and debris around the grounds and sites, and appearance of grounds, sites and entrance area. If a park complies with 3 or more items from the following list, a special green designation will show in their listing. Non-toxic cleaning products Natural pest control (most of the time) Minimized the use of styrofoam and significantly reduce the use of plastic Landscape managers use appropriate irrigation systems and drought tolerant and indigenous plants Recycling cans for the RVers Changed light bulbs to compact fluorescent lights (CFLs) Insulated water heaters Lowered pool temperatures Installed photocells (solar) Use more fuel efficient vehicles Instead of golf carts, implemented a strategy of encouraging the use of bikes and trikes Tankless water heaters Composting What makes this park family friendly? Good Sam Camping gives special recognition to RV Parks that provide family-friendly amenities, activities and services. Camp America / Reseberättelser / Nova, camp Namn: Nova Camp: Camp Echo Nova, camp Onsdag 11 September 2024 Antal veckor på camp: Jag spenderade cirka 8 veckor på camp. Första veckan var så kallad staff orientation, vilket innebar att förbereda all personal för deras roller och ansvar. Det inkluderar orientering och introduktion till lägrets mål och regler, säkerhetsutbildning, träning i specifika aktiviteter, team-building, genomgång av policyer och procedurer, samt rollspecifik träning. Målet är att alla ska vara väl förberedda och känna sig bekväma i sina roller innan lägret börjar. Jag jobbade där som videograf/fotograf, vi fick genomgång på vad som förväntades av oss och så satt vi upp alla datorer osv allt som behövdes, sen satt vi igång direkt att öva på att filma o redigera etc genom att sätta ihop vår första echo cast för all personal. Echocast var en video som vi visade för barnen varje söndag där vi hade deras skits, bits och reklamfilmer. Varför sökte du till Camp America? Först funderade jag på att åka som au pair, men efter att ha surfat runt på Skandinaviska Institutets hemsida hittade jag information om att man kunde jobba på ett sommarläger i USA. Jag insåg att det passade perfekt eftersom jag då kunde få en liknande upplevelse, men bara under 8 veckor, vilket gjorde det till en slags testperiod. Detta kändes som handen i handsken för mig eftersom jag alltid har tyckt om att arbeta med barn och ungdomar. Dessutom är det en unik möjlighet att få uppleva något som verkligen är ”once in a lifetime”. Att jobba på ett sommarläger i USA innebär att jag fick chansen att lära mig att hantera olika situationer som kan uppstå när man arbetar med barn. Det var också en fantastisk möjlighet att träffa nya människor från olika delar av världen och få vänner för livet. Genom att vara en del av lägergemenskapen fick jag också en djupare förståelse för amerikansk kultur och traditioner, vilket är ovärderligt. Berätta om ditt camp! Camp Echo är ett traditionellt sleep-away camp i Bloomingburg som ligger i staten New York. Vi var runt 200 anställda, majoriteten var internationella och resten var amerikanska. Lägret har två olika perioder antingen 3, 4 eller 7 veckor. Barnen var mellan 6 och 17 år gamla, vilket innebar att vi hade en stor variation av åldrar och intressen att ta hänsyn till. Lägret erbjöd en mängd olika aktiviteter, allt från ridning och höghöjdsbanor till kanotpaddling och konstverkstäder. Detta gjorde att varje barn kunde hitta något som de verkligen brann för, samtidigt som de fick chansen att prova på nya saker. Aktiviteterna var noggrant utvalda för att inte bara underhålla, utan också för att främja lagarbete, självförtroende och personligt växande. Alla bodde i cabins. I varje cabin bodde det mellan 2- 6 ledare med barnen beroende på hur många barn det var. Vi hade runt 300 barn under varje period. Jag var med i mediateamet så jag bodde med de andra från vårt mediateam eftersom att vår prio ett var att fånga de magiska ögonblicken vare sig de va att fota eller filma aktiviteterna som barnen gjorde på camp. Vi hade dock fortfarande varsin grupp med barn som vi var med när vi hade tid över. Hur såg en vanlig dag ut? Dagen började med att alla blev väckta varje morgon 8.15 via högtalaren som var kopplad in till varje bunk. Jag var med de yngre barnen så efter flaggan hade blivit hissad så gick de yngre barnen ner till frukost. Frukosten serverades vid 8.30 för de yngre barnen. Efter frukost så hade barnen cabin clean up som innebär att de städade upp i deras stuga. Efter det så gjorde man det som stog på schemat för dagen (varje grupp hade olika aktiviteter). Vi hade totalt 6 olika ”perioder” under dagen, tre före lunch och sedan tre efter lunch. Dessa perioderna höll på i 40 minuter var och det kunde va allt ifrån höghöjdsbana till att de skulle göra keramik i arts and crafts. Lunchen för de yngre barnen var 12.40 och sedan har de rest hour vilket innebär att de vila tills fjärde perioden börja. Sedan efter alla perioderna så har de snack and go 16.30 vilket var glass. Klockan 18 så åt de yngre barnen middag. Under både lunchen och middagen så var det en hel den sång och dans. Efter middagen så har de shower hour vilket var att alla barnen skulle duscha (vilket kunde va lite knepigt ibland för att de hade totalt 1 timme på sig och så var de kanske 15 barn som skulle duscha på den tiden.) Sedan klockan 20 så var det en kvällsaktivitet, det kunde var allt från smores till att det kom en hypnotisk och uppträdde. När kvällsaktiviteten var avslutad så fick barnen mjölk och kakor och sedan var det dags för de yngsta att börja gå och lägga sig. Vad var det bästa och det tuffaste med sommaren på campet? För att var ärlig hade jag nog sagt att hela upplevelsen var det bästa med camp. Framför allt så var de alla människorna som jag lärde känna vare sig det var barnen eller personalen. Det tuffaste hade jag nog sagt var att var sjuk på camp för att man känner att man missar så mycket och sedan så finns det risk att man får lite mer hemlängtan när man är sjuk. Vad gjorde du när du var ledig? När jag var ledig hade jag en kväll i veckan och oftast en dag i veckan ledigt, och de hängde ofta ihop. Vad vi gjorde berodde helt på vad vi kände för just den specifika kvällen, men ofta åkte vi till Middletown, som var den närmaste staden med många aktiviteter. Det fanns allt från karaoke och Walmart till bowling. Vi brukade också passa på att utforska andra delar av staden, äta på olika restauranger och bara njuta av att vara utanför campet. Det var en perfekt tid för att koppla av, ha kul och ladda batterierna inför kommande veckas aktiviteter. Vad skulle du säga till andra som funderar på att söka till Camp America med oss på Skandinaviska Institutet? Jag skulle säga: Sök!! Om du vill uppleva något du sent kommer att glömma, så är detta något för dig. Det kommer att vara som en berg- och dalbana, men det är 100% värt det i slutändan. Den unika möjligheten att arbeta med barn och ungdomar i en så rolig och unik miljö är verkligen en ”once in a lifetime”-upplevelse. Du kommer att skapa minnen som varar livet ut. Dessutom får du chansen att utforska en ny kultur och förbättra dina språkkunskaper, samtidigt som du utvecklas både personligt och professionellt. Det är en fantastisk chans att testa på något nytt och utmanande under en kortare period. Check-out is 11:00 AM. Please contact us at 386-767-0095 if you expect to arrive more than 24 hours after your check-in time. Otherwise, your deposit/payments will be forfeited and your site becomes available for others to rent. If you arrive late, you must still pay for site as reserved. In consideration for all of our guests, quiet time is 10:00 PM - 8 AM. Rates quoted are for 2 people, tax not included. 20 Amp electrical sites are not permitted to run A/C or high amp items. Due to the risk of infestation from other areas, outside firewood is not allowed to be brought into the campground. If you would like firewood, we can provide that for a small fee. Rates are subject to change without notice. There are absolutely no refunds. (Due to the intricate details of our pricing, we cannot issue refunds, except where noted in the policies above. Nova Campground thanks you for your cooperation and understanding on this matter.) Cancellation Policy If you provide a written request for cancellation at least 30 days prior to your check-in (or the first day of event period, whichever occurs first) we will honor the cancellation for a small fee of $20. Cancellations made less than 30 days prior to check-in are ineligible for refund. For non-events, a full refund (minus a $20 handling fee) will be issued if cancellation is made prior to 48 hours before check-in. For non-events, if cancellation is made within 48 hours of check-in, no payments will be refunded. All electric & water sites, plus cabins rentals, must be paid 30 days in advance of the first night of your stay, or prior to the start of event, whichever comes first. Pet Policy Animals must be leashed at all times. Pets must do business on your site. You must clean up after your pets. If they do their business while strolling around park, it is to be cleaned up immediately . Any undeclared pets will be removed from the park immediately (see General Park Info & Rules for restrictions). Failure to clean up after your pets will result in the whole campsite being removed from the park without a refund. Please do not leave your pet unattended in the park. The following breeds have certain restrictions (please call the office for further information): Pit Bull, Doberman, Rottweiler, German Shepherd . Unfortunately, no pets are allowed in our cabins. Park Rules Firewood is not permitted into the park. We are not responsible for weather damage or theft.  Camping is at your own risk. Dumpsters are provided and can be found marked on the park map. Please observe the traffic patterns indicated on your campground map. The speed limit is 5 MPH in park. Vehicles that block sites or road, or that are parked on sites which have not been paid for, will be towed at owner's expense. Please do not change your campsite without checking with the office. That site may already be assigned to someone else. Be courteous to your fellow campers! Please keep your camping area clean for the next party and leave your site as you would like to find it. The swimming pool is for registered guests only and there is no lifeguard on duty. Swimming is at your own risk. Children under age 16 are not permitted in the pool area unless accompanied by a parent or responsible party. We reserve the right to change your site or rate due to size requirements or unexpected developments. Motorcycles or mini-bikes are only to be used for transportation in or out of the campground. Pleasure riding within the park is not permitted. Absolutely NO FIREWORKS or FIREARMS are allowed . Discharge of such is a violation of city and state ordinances. Washing or repairing of vehicles / motorhomes in park is not permitted Only one (1) R.V. per site is permitted. No subletting of trailers. All clotheslines must be removed after using, no exceptions. Please do not attach clotheslines to trees, fences or poles. Clotheslines are not permitted after 6 PM. Management reserves the right to evict anyone from the campground for detrimental conduct or failure to observe the park rules and regulations. Your guests are welcome! Just have them stop by the front office to get registered as a guest. Lastly, have fun & happy camping! Δ Close Lakeland Hills Family YMCA 100 Fanny Road Mountain Lakes, NJ Phone: 973-334-2820 membership@lhymca.com Frequently Asked Questions What are your facility hours? Our hours are: Monday – Friday 5:00 A.M – 10:30 P.M. Saturday – Sunday 7:00 A.M. – 6:00 P.M. Directions Can I access other YMCA’s with my Lakeland Hills YMCA membership? Yes. We are proud to offer our members access to YMCA facilities across the United States and Canada that participate in Nationwide Membership. This way, our members can use the Y as often as they like, making it easier to achieve their health and wellness goals. Are group exercise classes available? Yes. We have over 65 weekly classes offered from Yoga to HIT. These classes offer a great workout in a class setting, and are all included with your membership. Can I bring a friend? Yes. As a member, you are given 3 guest passes per year. You can bring a friend up to 3X for free. After that there is a fee. Guests/friends can use facility a max of 3X per year and then must become a member. Is there a trial membership to try out the Y? Yes. We have a 1-Week Trial Membership for free.  After that, we have several options that you can choose as a new member. What benefits do I get with my membership? Full Privilege Membership entitles you to use the pool, basketball gymnasium, Health and Fitness Training Center, general membership locker rooms, as well as group fitness, yoga, spinning classes, and all aqua exercise classes. Plus, three free guest passes per year and a fitness orientation. Some age restrictions apply. Long Term Locker Membership offers full privilege membership plus an assigned locker and towel service in an adult only locker room which includes steam room, sauna and TV. What are the pool hours? For Pool Hours and available swim times, please visit our schedules page where you can download swim times as well as gymnasium and group fitness class times. Do you offer financial assistance? Yes. We offer financial aid to ensure that no one is turned away from a Y program or service due to an inability to pay. Visit our Financial Assistance page for more information. Jan 2023, the campground called and said I needed to pay for my Feb 2023 stay or lose my deposit and the price went up so I had to pay more money though the email they sent five months ago contained the lower price they originally quoted me. Some things we overlook but Bait and Switch is wrong and we've never had this kind of problem with any other campgrounds we have stayed in. Read Less Helpful 9 Own this park? All three ratings categories are measured on a scale of 1 to 10, with 10 being the best. Less than 1 percent of parks or campgrounds receive the coveted 10 | 10 | 10 rating, which indicates superior facilities that are well maintained, clean, well-appointed restrooms and a highly appealing appearance. Campgrounds are inspected annually by dedicated RVers like you. Completeness of facilities 10 10 10 The first campground rating evaluates completeness and quality of facilities. In this category we rate interior roads, sites, registration area, hookups, recreation, swimming, security, laundry, store and building maintenance. Cleanliness of restrooms and showers 10 10 10 The second rating category concerns the cleanliness and physical characteristics of toilets, walls, showers, sinks/counters/mirrors and floor. If a park achieves a full point in each of the above, it receives a star ( ), indicating exceptionally clean restrooms. Also rated are physical characteristics of restrooms, including interior construction, adequate supplies/odor free, adequate number of facilities, exterior appearance and location in relation to park spaces, and interior appearance. Visual appeal and environmental quality 10 10 10 This category addresses the park's setting and site layout, function and identification of signage, overall exterior building maintenance, noise, trash disposal, litter and debris around the grounds and sites, and appearance of grounds, sites and entrance area. If a park complies with 3 or more items from the following list, a special green designation will show in their listing. Non-toxic cleaning products Natural pest control (most of the time) Minimized the use of styrofoam and significantly reduce the use of plastic Landscape managers use appropriate irrigation systems and drought tolerant and indigenous plants Recycling cans for the RVers Changed light bulbs to compact fluorescent lights (CFLs) Insulated water heaters Lowered pool temperatures Installed photocells (solar) Use more fuel efficient vehicles Instead of golf carts, implemented a strategy of encouraging the use of bikes and trikes Tankless water heaters Composting What makes this park family friendly? Jan 2023, the campground called and said I needed to pay for my Feb 2023 stay or lose my deposit and the price went up so I had to pay more money though the email they sent five months ago contained the lower price they originally quoted me. Their electrical box made a sizzling sound when we plugged into the 30 amp so we plugged into the 50 amp and used a dogbone.  Backing into the site required maneuvering around old trees.  When leaving the campground, they have a sign to swing wide to avoid hitting a tree limb that overhangs the exit.  (Why not trim the tree?)   One Pro:  Campers were very friendly. Our vision. New Life Camp exists to love, accept, and introduce children and their families to Jesus Christ and equip them to live lives that glorify God. We strive to be a location where children and their families are accepted and exposed to the love of Jesus while experiencing adventure, exhilaration, equipping, and belonging. DIVE DEEPER What We Believe As Christians, there are certain essential truths we believe: 01. The Bible is the inspired Word of God. 02. Jesus is fully God and fully man. 03. All have sinned. 04. Jesus died for our sins, was buried and rose again. 05. Through faith and repentance of our sins, we gain God’s forgiveness. 06. The Holy Spirit lives inside all those who follow Christ. 07. Jesus will come again for His church. 08. There will be a day of judgment. 09. God hears and answers our prayers according to His will. 70 Years and Counting We are so thankful to be celebrating over 70 years of ministry. We carry a rich legacy of walking with children and families toward Christ and seek for that legacy to grow. Our desire at New Life Camp is to show and share the love of God in a practical way through summer camp, sports, enrichment activities, and the many other events that God has provided. Our prayer is that all who enter into their beautiful 72-acre camp have a unique, fun, and safe experience while being invited to encounter and worship Jesus Christ. We welcome the opportunity and the privilege to serve and minister to your family at New Life Camp! OUR HISTORY What We Do We incorporate the Gospel and biblical teaching through a variety of programs and rental opportunities for the whole family to enjoy. PROGRAMS Jeff Beckett Executive Director The New Life Camp Family We would not be where we are today without our Lord and our NLC family. Our staff, leaders, volunteers, partners and supporters make us who we are and enable us to continue moving our mission forward. There is a $15 handling fee if you provide us a written request for cancellation 30 or more days  prior to check-in or the first day of event period, whichever occurs first. Cancellations made less than 30 days prior to check-in are ineligible for refund.
2.	For non-events, a refund minus $15 handling fee will be returned if cancellation is made over 48 hrs prior to check-in.  If cancellation is made within 48 hrs of check-in no payments will be refunded.
3.	All Electric & Water sites and Cabins rentals must be paid 30 days in advance prior to start of event or first night whichever comes first. Pet Policy 1.	 All animals are to be leashed at all times.
2.	 You must clean up after your pets and allow them to potty on your site (no one else's).
3.	 If they potty while strolling around park, it is to be cleaned up immediately.
4.	 Any undeclared pets will be removed from the park immediately (see General Park Rules for restrictions).
5.	 Failure to clean up after your pets will result in the whole campsite being removed from the park and no refund issued.
6.	 Unfortunately, no pets are allowed in our cabins. General Policies 1.	Check-in is 1:00 p.m.  Check-out is 11:00 a.m.  Please contact us at 386-767-0095 if you expect to arrive more than 24 hours after your check-in time. Otherwise, your deposit/payments will be forfeited and your site becomes available for others to rent.  If you arrive late, you must still pay for site as reserved.
2.	In consideration for all of our guests, quiet time is 10:00 P.M. - 8 A. M.
3.	Rates quoted are for 2 people, tax not included
4.	20 Amp electrical sites are not permitted to run A/C or high amp items
5.	Due to the risk of infestation from other areas, outside firewood is not allowed to be brought into the campground.  If you would like firewood, we can provide that for a small fee.
6.	THERE ARE NO REFUNDS
7.	Rates are subject to change
8.	No firewood allowed to be brought into the park.
9.	We are not responsible for weather damage or theft.  Camping is at your own risk.
10.	Dumpsters are provided in areas marked on the park map. 
11.	Please observe the traffic patterns indicated on your campground map. The speed limit is 5 M.P.H. throughout our park.
12.	Any vehicles blocking sites or road  or parked on sites which have not been paid for will be towed at owner's expense.
13.	Check out time is 11 a.m.  Please notify the office before then if you plan to stay longer.  Late fees may apply.
14.	Do not change your campsite without checking with the office.  That site may already be assigned to someone else.
15.	The swimming pool is for registered guests only. Please observe all safety precautions posted at the pool.  There is no lifeguard on duty and anyone swimming does so at his/her own risk.  Children under age 16 are not permitted in the pool area unless accompanied by a parent or responsible party.
16.	We reserve the right to change your site or rate due to size requirements or unexpected developments.
17.	Motorcycles or mini-bikes are to be used only for transportation in or out of the campground.  Pleasure riding with the campground is not permitted.
18.	Absolutely NO FIREWORKS or FIREARMS are allowed.  Discharge of such is a violation of city and state ordinances.
19.	Pets are welcome, but they must be kept on a leash, kept quiet and not left unattended in camp.  Walk your pet in the wooded areas and pick up waste. The following breeds have restrictions on staying in the park (call the office for further information): Pit Bull, Doberman, Rottweiler, German Shepherd.
20.	No washing or repairing of vehicles / motorhomes in park.
21.	One R.V. per site.  No subletting of trailers.
22.	We ask your cooperation in keeping the area clean for the next party.  Please leave your campsite as you would like to find it.
23.	Please be considerate of your fellow campers. Quiet time is 10:00 P.M. - 8 A. M.
24.	Management reserves the right to evict anyone from the campground for detrimental conduct or failure to observe the park rules and regulations.
25.	All clotheslines must be removed after using, no exceptions.  No clotheslines after 6 P.M.  Please do not attach clotheslines to trees, fences or poles.
26.	Your guests are welcome, but they must be registered at the office.
